abstract: An architecture critic's enthusiastic look at a Cooper-Hewitt design show, on display at the United Nations, on ideas to improve slum conditions in the poorest parts of the world.
snippet: An architecture critic's enthusiastic look at a Cooper-Hewitt design show, on display at the United Nations, on ideas to improve slum conditions in the poorest parts of the world.
lead_paragraph: I write in Sunday's Arts & Leisure section about an ambitious and excellent design show devoted to what might seem like an unlikely topic: improving slum conditions in some of the poorest parts of the world.

headline.main: Design for the Poor. (And Yes, This Is Serious.)
